result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas Alan Elrod was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lucas Alan Elrod is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lucas Alan Elrod was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs in this case were remitted by the Court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

ADDRESS INFO for Lucas Alan Elrod
Current: 26155 Ewing Ln, Richland Center, WI 53581 United States  (Effective: 11-14-2016)
Prior: 412 N. Jefferson St., Richland Center, WI 53581 United States

Defendant Lucas Alan Elrod in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. 16CM8 and 15CT52 called together, along with TR and FO matters.  Counsel advise Court the parties have an agreement for resolution calling for dismissal of the TR and FO matters and def's pleas to count 1/OWI 2nd in 15CT52 and to count 1/resisting in 16CM8 for probation dispo with imposed/stayed jail and conditional jail time for the OWI and probation for the resisting charge.  Def pleads no contest to both counts.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Atty. M asks the Court to imposed costs on the OWI only; not on the resisting; and make the OWI fine/costs a condition of probation.

15CT52:  Sentenced imposed/stayed for probation 2 years.  I/S: 20 days in jail.  Condition of probation:  5 days conditional jail to begin today with work release/huber.  $1555 total fine/costs, condition of probation.  14 mo DL revocation.  14 mo IID upon relicensing.  AODA/driver safety plan to be relicensed.  1 day credit in the event of revocation.  $69 blood draw reimbursement to R County.  

16CM8 - Sentence withheld for 2 years probation.  Costs remitted in this case.

Def remanded to custody of the sheriff in 15CT52.

TR/FO cases dismissed.

1 day credit to be used on the OWI case in the event of revocation - not to be applied towards the 5 days conditional time.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Several cases called together:  intake in 16TR13, 15TR2062, 16FO1, and 16TR12 and adjourned initial in 16CM8 and 15CT52.  DA Harper appears for the State and County.  Def appears with Atty. Lisa McDougal who represents him in the CM and CT cases.  Parties requests that these matters all be set over to June 1 at 9.  So ordered.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
